name: Priti Patel
Basic Info: Priti Patel, Conservative MP for Witham
Property Analysis: Priti Patel voted against the Renters' Rights Bill, which would have improved tenant rights.
max_hospitality_description: Two tickets with hospitality in the Legends Suite at Silverstone for the British Grand Prix (£1,650 each)
DonorCategories: the Premier League and its clubs, the Embassy of Bahrain
Hospitality Analysis:
Priti Patel has received a total of £12,040 in hospitality and gifts since the last election.
This means he!she ranks at #7 for most hospitality received.
The most expensive declaration was worth £3,300, described as 'Two tickets with hospitality in the Legends Suite at Silverstone for the British Grand Prix (£1,650 each)' from Silverstone Circuits Ltd.
He!She has received 7 gifts valued at over £500.
He!She has declared gifts or hospitality from the Premier League and its clubs and the Embassy of Bahrain.
The Premier League and its clubs have been lobbying to water down regulations designed to ensure greater sharing of revenues throughout the sport.
The UK government has been accused of collusion with the oppressive practices of the government of Bahrain by continuing to sell them arms despite well-documented human rights abuses.
Other Analysis:
Priti Patel has claimed a total of £8,295 in expenses since the last election.
His!Her expense total all comes from office costs.

name: Paul Waugh
Basic Info: Paul Waugh, Labour MP for Rochdale
Property Analysis:
He!She has claimed £13,264 in accommodation expenses since the last election.
He!She has claimed for his!her utility bills to be paid by the taxpayer. Even so, in 2024 he!she voted to abolish universal winter fuel payments for 10 million pensioners. 2.5 million of these pensioners had 'incomes below levels needed for a dignified life', according to the Centre for Ageing Better.
He!She has claimed £836 for utility bills for his!her personal accommodation.

Paul Waugh has claimed a total of £36,339 in expenses since the last election.
His!Her expense total comes from £13,264 in accommodation costs, £20,934 in office costs and £2,140 in staffing costs.

She has declared gifts or hospitality from the Premier League and its clubs and racing and gambling bodies.

Racing and gambling companies have been lobbying to reduce protections for gambling addicts and reduce the taxes collected on gambling.

In 2024, she voted to abolish universal winter fuel payments for 10 million pensioners. 2.5 million of these pensioners had 'incomes below levels needed for a dignified life', according to the Centre for Ageing Better.
She voted in support of the UC and PIP bill, which will cut the universal credit allowance for many disabled people by £2,080 per year.

Housing and Accommodation:

She has claimed £18,883 in accommodation expenses since the last election.

You can get more detail from IPSA or Parliament about her expenses and financial interests.
